articles.title: Astronomers Discover Mysterious Repeating Bursts of Radio Waves From Outer Space - SciTechDaily
articles.description: In radio astronomy, a fast radio burst (FRB) is a transient radio pulse of length ranging from a fraction of a millisecond to a few milliseconds, caused by some mysterious high-energy astrophysical process that has not yet been discovered. Astronomers estimat…
articles.content: Artists conception of a neutron star with an ultra-strong magnetic field, called a magnetar, emitting radio waves (red). Magnetars are a leading candidate for what generates Fast Radio Bursts. Credit… [+5821 chars]

articles.author: Shivali Best
articles.title: Scientists dismiss fears Earth's magnetic poles will flip, causing widespread blackouts - Daily Mail
articles.description: Researchers from Lund University have pieced together data on Earth's geomagnetic field strength stretching back 9,000 years and say there's no evidence a reversal is on the cards.
articles.content:
The idea of Earth's magnetic poles flipping may sound like the plot of the latest science fiction blockbuster yet many scientists believe it could happen at any time.

articles.author: James Lee
articles.title: Russia sparks panic as it tries to hijack orbiting satellite and take it out 'safe mode' - Express
articles.description: RUSSIA has caused concern as it tries to hijack a German satellite orbiting the Earth over one million miles away and take it out of 'safe mode'.

articles.author: Antony Ashkenaz
articles.title: NASA launches 'priority' plan to investigate strange domes spotted on the Moon - Express
articles.description: NASA has announced it is launching a new 'top priority' plan to investigate mysterious domes discovered on the surface of the Moon.

articles.title: Please, don't build another Large Hadron Collider. - Big Think
articles.description: A next-generation LHC++ could cost $100 billion. Here's why such a machine could end up being massive waste of money.
